application.doc: Exporting the filtered System Event Log

param.name: field
param.doc: The field to apply the given filter to. Possible values: "occurred", "description", "eventid", "priority", "all".

param.name: filter
param.doc: The filter pattern to be applied against the given field. The '*'' wildcard character can be used.

method.name: GET
method.id: Exporting the filtered System Event Log
method.doc: To export the event log with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the system events log resource URI with a {field} and {filter} added to the path.

request.doc:
Retrieving all events with a "priority" value which matches the pattern "high*" GET https://{appliance_hostname}/events/system/priority/high*
Retrieving all events with an "occurred" value which matches the pattern "1523364226" GET https://{appliance_hostname}/events/system/occurred/1523364226 Note: There is an additional API "Exporting the filtered System Event Log Using a Date Range" which can be used to return events based on time ranges.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc:
200 ok
[ { id: 200, "occurred": "152338638", "eventid": "WGAWA0643E", "priority" "high", "description": "High CPU utilization: 100%", "tzOffset": 36000000 }, { id: 192, "occurred": "1523374590", "eventid": "WGAWA0643E", "priority" "high", "description": "High CPU utilization: 100%", "tzOffset": 36000000 } ]

representation.name: events_log
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: occurred
param.doc: The time of the Event, a numerical number that indicates Unix time in seconds.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
